transcript.title: FOR PRESS: P.M.NO. 85/1963 VISIT OF HER MAJESTY QUEEN ELIZABETH THE QUEEN MOTHER STATEMENT BY THE PRIME MINISTER, RT, HON. SIR ROBERT MENZIES
transcript.content:
EMBARGO: NOT TO BE CABLED, BROADCAST OR TELECAST BEFORE
6 P. M. E. S. T. FRIDAY, 25TH OCTOBER, 1963
FOR PRESS P2M. o. 85/ 1963
VISIT OF HElR MAJESTY QUEEN ELIZABETH THE
QUEEN MOTHER
Statement by the Prime Minister, Rt. Hon. Sir Robert Menzies
The Prime Minister announced in Canberra today
that Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth The Queen Mother had accepted
the following itinerary for her visit to Australia next year
which is primarily for the purpose of opening the Third
Adelaide Festival of Arts
Friday, 28th February Afternoon
Tuesday, 3rd March
Morning
Thursday, 5th March
Afternoon:
Saturday, 7th March
Morning
Monday, 16th March
After Dinner Arrive at Canberra by air
from New Zealand
Engagements in Canberra.
Leave Canberra by air for Hobart.
Engagements in Tasmania
Leave Burnie by H. M. Y. BRITANNIA
for Adelaide
Arrive at Port Adelaide
Engagements in South Australia.
Leave Port Adelaide by H. M. Y.
BRITANNIA for journey to
Fremantle.
En route to Fremantle H. M. Y. BRITANNIA will
anchor off Esperance, Albany and Bunbury to
enable Her Majesty to make brief calls ashore.
Monday, 23rd March
Morning
Wednesdayq 25th March
Afternoon Arrive at Fremantle
Engagements in Perth
Depart from Perth by air for
London.
The Prime Minister also said that a programme of
engagements is now being prepared for Queen Elizabeth's
Australian visit and that an announcement of these details
would have to wait until the proposals have been referred to
and accepted by Her Majesty.
CANB ERRA, October, 1963.
